questions.question_text:
You want to move financial information from Projects to Financials for account level data.
Which describes the action you can take to accomplish this? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.C: On the Financials Integration Summary form, from the Actions menu, select PFP Detail to calculate project data.
choices.A: In data maps, push data for the predefined Financial Statement Integration.
choices.D: In Financials, run the Financials Integration business rule to update data from Projects.
choices.B: Rollup project data which pushes data to Financials based on account mappings.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: B
Explanations: When a planner rolls up the Projects cube (using the rules OPF_Rollup Projects and Rollup Project Cube), the data is moved to Financials.
References: 
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/planning-budgeting-cloud/epbca/general_mapping_data_to_integrate_business_processes_104xf4672053.html

Selected Answer: E
Correct Answer: E

questions.question_text: What three time period management tasks can you perform in Strategic Modeling? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Select and combine periods of years, halves, quarters, months, and weeks for the beginning balance year.
choices.D: Create period-to-date, trailing periods, deal periods, and sub periods to record transactions.
choices.A: Combine periods of years, halves, quarters, months, and weeks for historical forecast data.
choices.C: Enable the input option for upper level time periods when you add time detail.
choices.B: Configure time periods to reflect the detail required by financial models, such as different levels of granularity for different years.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding the creation and management of business rules in module-based Planning? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Custom business rules can be created for each module.
choices.A: Pre-defined business rules for modules may be modified, but may be ignored after an application upgrade.
choices.B: Custom business rules for modules can only be created using the graphical designer.
choices.D: Modules cannot use regular business rules. Instead, they must be scripted using Groovy.
